fact: several factories and research facilities were left mostly intact.
Retrieve the information he's holding on the salvage location and deliver it to Catherine Malin in Fallbrook.
Take the passcode you found on the SubLight agent's body to Catherine in Fallbrook.
She'll provide details on how to salvage the Alta-Vitae gas.
Talk to Mortimer Bell near the entrance and,
The passwored "ANTEDILUVIAN" should get you inside the hidden lab.
To get the gas offworld, signal ADA from the message terminal inside the Cascadia lab.
She'll prepare the ship for the fueling connection.
Go to the far end of the room,
Before his death, Hawthorne was considered a dear friend by the Groundbreaker's resident Board representative Udom Bedford,
though it is unclear if the sentiment was returned.
He also had done business with Lilya Hagen,
the CEO of SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation,
who is also based aboard the Groundbreaker.
Hawthorne preferred solitude rather than company on his flights.
He was also mechanically trained,
with the ability to install the Vocational Competence Respecification Machine in the Unreliable.
He would often play board games and socialize with ADA.
At some point he was hired by Phineas Vernon Welles to help the Stranger in their mission to free the remaining colonists aboard the Hope.
In his final moments, he was holding onto the guide beacon for the Stranger's pod to make its landing.
Rather than putting the beacon down and stepping away,
Hawthorne was crushed by the Stranger's pod when it made landfall on Terra 2.
His ship's AI, ADA, believes this error in judgement might have been due to a recent head injury.
The Stranger eventually takes command of his ship, the Unreliable,
and takes his name as an alias.
Cascadia is an abandoned company town that was owned and operated by Rizzo's before it withdrew from Monarch.
It is now used as a stronghold by the Marauders.
The main attraction is the Cascadia Bottling Plant and,
for those in the know,
the Rizzo Secret Laboratory hidden underneath the Rizzo Sweets Shoppe.
Catherine Malin is the outpost administrator of Fallbrook and owner of Malin's House of Hospitality.
Catherine, acting on behalf of SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation, is the "top dog" in Fallbrook, and a mastermind behind it's construction.
She is known for a violent temper and won't hesitate to hire a hitman to get somebody whacked.
Sanjar Nandi is afraid of Catherine.
According to him, she has certain ambitions for Stellar Bay and Sanjar fears asking her for help during Errors Unseen because it may give her the leverage she has been looking for.
Celia, his assistant, tries to calm him down and says it's perfectly normal to have a healthy fear of her.
Fallbrook is a company town located on Monarch,
loosely run by the SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation.
Fallbrook is a small town built into the side of a mountain,
whose construction was masterminded by Catherine Malin.
Fallbrook has a lot of activities to offer to its visitors,
from those who search for activities of leisure to those with proclivities for vice.
UDL-001 The Groundbreaker or simply Groundbreaker was the first colony ship to arrive in Halcyon during the Crossing.
By 2355, it has been converted into an independent orbital station,
and is the only place in the entire Halcyon system that is not controlled by the Halcyon Holdings Corporate Board or any other corporation.
The crew of the Groundbreaker is fiercely protective of their independence from the corporations,
and the corporations value the station's role as a thriving freeport enough that they are willing to deal with it on relatively equal terms.
In practical terms, while the Groundbreaker rules itself,
it cooperates with the corporations to an extent,
such as by impounding ships that the Board happens to flag.
The Groundbreaker is commanded by engineer-turned-captain Junlei Tennyson.
Udom Bedford is the Halcyon Holdings Corporation representative stationed aboard.
According to Junlei, lots of corners were cut when the ship was built,
prompting Captain Guiying Tennyson to spend half of her career attempting to patch the ship back together after the Crossing from Earth to Halcyon.
In addition, the ship has tinkerings and bypasses that only the Tennysons know about.
The Groundbreaker maintains a somewhat tense relationship with the Board,
owing to their declared independence from Board authority,
as well as their control of shipping routes outward from the Halcyon System.
Nonetheless, given that Groundbreaker lacks any semblance of military might against the Board beyond the mardets stationed aboard the ship,
the loose hierarchy in charge of the Groundbreaker often seeks to find (illicit) ways of delaying, stymieing, or pitting corporations under the Board's thumb against each other,
usually through black market fences like Gladys Culkelly.
Nonetheless, the Board maintains an embassy aboard the Groundbreaker run by bureaucrat Udom Bedford.
Depending on the actions of the Stranger, the Groundbreaker's crew may be compelled to rebel against the Board's system-wide authority.
The Groundbreaker is generally neutral to Sublight Salvage and Shipping Corporation,
and allows them to operate an office and warehouse aboard the ship, helmed by Lilya Hagen.
Lilya Hagen is the CEO of SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation,
based aboard the Groundbreaker.
Not much is known about Lilyaâ€™s early life besides for being a descendant from the original Groundbreaker colonists.
At some point Lilya joined the SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation and worked her way up to CEO.
The company was a full time job which caused her to lose sleep making her impatient and emotionless.
Lilya eventually only cared about profit and started to invest in dangerous jobs which (if not caught) would make her very rich.
Not wanting to get her hands dirty,
Lilya offers these jobs to mercenaries,
this eventually gets the attention of the Stranger.
She gets them to do to big jobs until she thinks a scientist in Byzantium is helping aliens after seeing evidence from the jobs.
If the scientist gets killed,
she makes the Stranger a high-ranking member.
Monarch, previously known as Terra 1, is one of the many moons of the gas giant Olympus and the site of a failed colony.
Terra 1 was initially designated as the primary colonization target of the Halcyon system.
The Halcyon Holdings Corporate Board had intended to completely terraform the moon,
wiping out the local fauna and flora and replacing it with plants and wildlife native to Earth.
However, the terraforming process unexpectedly caused the native species to mutate and grow to significantly larger sizes,
rendering them more dangerous and severely crippling the colonization effort.
Due to the hostile environment which they had created,
the Board was forced to enact a Hazard Clause covering the entirety of Terra 1.
Public notice of the clause's issuance was sent to everyone operating on Terra 1 and led to the evacuation of almost all corporations from the moon.
However, one corporation took advantage of the chaos of the evacuation to exploit a legal loophole which allowed them to,
as the last corporation remaining on the planet,
acquire the planet from the Board.
This corporation, under the leadership of Sanjar Nandi and Graham Bryant subsequently rebranded itself to Monarch Stellar Industries (MSI),
in line with the renaming of the planet to 'Monarch'.
The actions of MSI earned them the ire of the Board,
who retaliated by effectively placing the moon under indefinite embargo,
refusing to allow legal transit either in or out.
the Board aggressively spread propaganda about Monarch to convince the rest of the population that it was both uninhabited and uninhabitable.
This has greatly hampered MSI's attempts to be recognized as a legitimate corporation and is a thorn in the side of its CEO, Sanjar Nandi.
Monarch also has an ocean which goes around the moon at the "twilight band".
It is where the colonists and Monarch Stellar Industries farm their saltuna.
Rizzo's Secret Laboratory is an underground location in Cascadia.
A password protected labratory originally owned by Rizzo for flavor research and development.
Prior to the Board enacting the Hazard Clause,
Rizzo volunteered to provide lab space for the chimerist Eva Chartrand and her team to conduct experiments to "lead to a better Halcyon".
The tests conducted in the lab were primarily animal tests,
with the test subjects including native fauna of Monarch (then called Terra 1) and cystypigs from the nearby C&P Boarst Factory.
One human trial was also done in the lab,
as one member of the research team, Thomas Lynwood Ryall,
sacrificed himself to further the research that the team was doing.
The tank containing his body can be found in one of the chambers.
Regardless, the team was not able to make significant strides in their research prior to the companies pulling out of Terra 1,
when the project was reassigned to a secondary lab.

The SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation, also known as SubLight Salvage and Shipping or simply SubLight , is a network of "salvagers" with business ties to "transportation" and "waste disposal".
A tangled web of contractors and secretive vice presidents make up their official hierarchy,
leaving no one to speak on the record about SubLight's more legally dubious activities.
SubLight as a business operates activities that would be considered illicit by some,
amoral by others,
and at odds with the Board,
such as the takeover of abandoned space habitats,
smuggling contraband,
and serving as a front for companies to bypass the infamous Hazard Clause applied on Monarch.
According to director Lilya Hagen,
operating off of Groundbreaker,
SubLight "occupies a legal blind spot.
No one knows what [they're] licensed to do,
and that gives [their] little business some freedom."
Although the Board tolerates and sees the value of SubLight's activities,
there are still limits to what the latter can get away with.
SubLight maintains an office aboard the Groundbreaker as well as a settlement on Monarch known as Fallbrook.
The Unreliable is a Yakita LHA one-twenty, A-two Apex Transport starship,
constructed in 2325,
that the Stranger uses to travel across Halcyon.
It is the player character's mobile base.
The ship's systems are managed by the AI ADA.
Originally christened the Reliable it came into the possession of Captain Alex Hawthorne,
who renamed it the Unreliable and used it for smuggling across the colonies.
Hawthorne ended up in the Halcyon system by 2355,
where he was hired by Phineas Vernon Welles to aid the Stranger in a bid to liberate the colonists of the Hope,
a late-arriving colony ship that the Halcyon Holdings Corporate Board decided to abandon and cover up.
After Hawthorne's accidental death on Terra 2,
the Stranger assumed ownership of the vessel and set about searching for a new power regulator for it.
Hawthorne was responsible for ADA's programming and modification.
He made her solely responsible for the ship's operating and navigation systems and conceived ADA her own personality to make the crew instance more enjoyable during their travels.
He also installed a shock-trap on the airlock in the event of an invasion.
Now, the unreliable is The Stranger's starship.
